page.title: 07FARMING
page.content: In this area there are 7{farms}and 1 market garden most of them are arable farms. The smallest is 100 acres the largest is 720 acres. Farmers use large{machines}and so the fields have been made bigger as the hedges have been knocked down. This together with the death of the elms (Dutch elm disease) has made the countryside very bare. Most of the farms only employ about 2 workers but the large market garden employs 50. Some of the best soil in England is here but there is not enough rain to water the crops so the farmers build reservoirs and there are irrigation pipes coming from the reservoirs to the fields to water the crops. Several farms keep pigs. One farm has a flock of sheep and fattens bullocks.Another farm has a dairy herd.
